page.title: 10TOURISM - ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: A.A.Milne who lived at Cotchford Farm on the edge of Ashdown Forest wrote Winnie the Pooh and House at Pooh Corner. The illustrator of the books, E.H.Shepard, stayed with him there and together they capture an essence of the Forest in the books. Owl's House in the Hundred Acre wood can be identified in the 500 Acre Wood; the Sandy Place where Roo and Piglet practised jumping and the Lone Pine Tree are near to Gill's Lap, the Enchanted Place on the top of the Forest and thousands of tourists make their way to Pooh Bridge, not far from Cotchford Farm, to play Pooh Sticks. Close to Gill's Lap there is now a memorial to A.A.Milne and E.H.Shepard whose inspired collaberation gave the Pooh books to the world.
